title: PagerDuty, Palo Alto Networks, and Splunk Among New Verified Terraform Providers
content:
The growth of our HashiCorp Terraform provider ecosystem continues to accelerate, with more than 160 verified providers giving practitioners the ability to automate the use of an even wider set of tools throughout their infrastructure deployments.

»Welcoming New Verified Providers

The past three months have been eventful for HashiCorp Terraform, as we welcomed 17 new verified providers to our ecosystem. All of these providers have gone through our partner onboarding process and earned the “Verified” tag that ensures that the source is legitimate.

Here is a short description of each provider — in alphabetical order with links to explore further details or download them directly from the registry:

»BetterStack

BetterStack builds DevOps tools for logging and monitoring. BetterStack maintains the Logtail and BetterUpTime Terraform providers, which enable users to manage BetterStack resources as code.

»BigStepCloud (metalsoft)

The Bigstep Bare Metal Cloud offers direct hardware access for latency, stability, and performance sensitive workloads. The Metalcloud provider gives users the option to provision bare metal servers, switches, iSCSI drives, control firewalls, and more via Terraform.

»Britive

Britive is a cloud-native security solution that provides centralized privileged access security for cloud-forward enterprises. The Britive Terraform provider is used to interact with the resources supported by Britive.

»Fivetran

Fivetran improves the accuracy of data-driven decisions by continuously synchronizing data from source applications to any destination, allowing analysts to work with the freshest possible data. The Fivetran Terraform provider allows you to provision and manage Fivetran connectors, destinations, and users in code.

»G-Core Labs

G-CORE LABS provides powerful edge and cloud solutions for media business and the entertainment industry. The Terraform provider for G-Core Labs supports a wide variety of resources, including bare metal instances, load balancers, and network infrastructure.

»Genesys

Genesys Cloud CX is designed to take full advantage of modern cloud strategies and technologies. The Terraform provider for Genesys Cloud implements many resources to interact with the Genesys Cloud Public API.

»Harness

Harness is a software delivery platform that utilizes artificial intelligence to simplify DevOps processes. The Terraform provider for Harness allows users to manage Harness resources across the API.

»Instaclustr

The Instaclustr Terraform provider allows users to control lifecycle management of Instaclustr managed services including Cassandra, Kafka, Redis, Elasticsearch, and more using infrastructure as code.

»Iterative

The Terraform provider for Iterative supports MLOps as code including Iterative machine learning lifecycle management, GPU and CPU provisioning, spot-instances handling, dataset synchronization, and machine-learning model management.

»PagerDuty

PagerDuty is an alarm aggregation and dispatching service for system administrators and support teams. It collects alerts from your monitoring tools, gives you an overall view of all of your monitoring alarms, and alerts an on-duty engineer if there’s a problem. The Terraform provider for PagerDuty makes it easy to manage infrastructure responsible for alerts and notifications using infrastructure as code.

»Palo Alto Networks

Palo Alto Networks offers a wide range of products to secure networks, protect cloud applications, and enable the secure operations center.The PrismaCloudCompute Terraform provider enables users to manage Prisma Cloud Compute controls and define their cloud workload protection policies as code.

»Satori Cyber

The Satori Terraform provider defines resources to interact with the Satori management API that allows data engineers to implement users’ data entitlements in a declarative way, including provisioning datasets as well as setting access and security policies.

»Shipa

Shipa, an application as code platform, integrates with Terraform through the Terraform provider for Shipa to create a complete workflow with a strong developer and operations experience.

»Splunk

Splunk technology is designed to investigate, monitor, analyze and act on data at any scale. Splunk offers a number of Terraform providers, the latest is for SplunkConfig. The Terraform provider for Splunkconfig enables operators to provision and manage Splunkconfig resources as a part of their standard Terraform workflow.

»Thales

Thales helps companies protect sensitive information and software wherever it is created, accessed, or stored — from the cloud and datacenters to devices and across networks. The CipherTrust Terraform provider allows for the incorporation of Thales CipherTrust Cloud Key Manager functionality into a CI/CD pipeline.

»VMware

VMware is a provider of multi-cloud services for apps, enabling digital innovation with enterprise control. There are several existing verified providers for VMware. The latest addition, Terraform provider for Carvel, supplies a set of reliable, single-purpose, composable tools that aid in application building, configuration, and deployment to Kubernetes.

»Wallix

The integration of WALLIX Application-to-Application Password Manager with HashiCorp Terraform environments via the Terraform provider for WAAPM enables secure access for DevOps tools or robots.

»Verify Your Provider

Interested in making it easier to provision and manage infrastructure as code? Visit registry.terraform.io and check out all of the available Terraform integrations. To verify an existing provider, check out our Terraform Provider Development Program.

We also invite you to try the free tier of Terraform Cloud to help simplify your Terraform workflows and management.
author: Alejandra Velasquez
